comment._content: Thanks Worldsfair39, I checked the date and it opened in Sydney December 1928. Sorry about that. The film was made in 1927 ?
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 86916510@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw] The "The Jazz Singer's" opening in Sydney would have definitely been a significant while after it's US release as the theatre needed to invest and install a sound system for the very first time. "Cinesound talkies opening here soon". Quite an event for Pitt Street.The photo might even date as late as 1929 as "The Leopard Lady" was released in 1928. (It was silent though). 

Coincidently, when I look outside my office window, I look down at the Wesley Centre...the very same location.
